definition: to come back from death's door (idiom); unexpected rescue from danger/fig. to recover from a seemingly impossible situation/to find a way out of a predicament
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
variant of 絕|绝[jue2]
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: He was unexpectedly rescued from the desert.
sentences.chinese: 他绝处逢生，从沙漠被救了回来。

sentences.english: Xiaoping always has luck and ability to be unexpected rescued from a desperate situation.
sentences.chinese: 小萍从来有绝处逢生的本领和运气。

sentences.english: Desperate villagers who tried to force their way into the towns were greeted with machine-gun fire .
sentences.chinese: 以为逃到城镇可以绝处逢生的农民被机枪扫射。

sentences.english: Ah, don't you understand the reason of be unexpected rescued from a desperate situation?
sentences.chinese: 呵呵，难道你不明白绝处逢生的道理吗？

definition: lit. the willow trees make the shade, the flowers give the light (idiom); at one's darkest hour, a glimmer of hope/light at the end of the tunnel
desperate straits
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert disaster

place sb on a field of death and he will fight to live (idiom based on Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3]); to fight desperately when confronting mortal danger/fig. to find a way out of an impasse
pinyin: zhi4 zhi1 si3 di4 er2 hou4 sheng1

definition: to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
the mountain road twists around each new peak (idiom)/(of a mountain road) twisting and turning/fig. an opportunity has come unexpectedly/things have taken a new turn
lit. to upend heaven and earth (idiom)/fig. to change the course of events/to turn things around
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); snatching victory from the jaws of defeat
mortal danger, escape alive (idiom); a narrow escape/to survive by the skin of one's teeth
Heaven never bars one's way (idiom); don't despair and you will find a way through./Never give up hope./Never say die.
pinyin: tian1 wu2 jue2 ren2 zhi1 lu4

definition: to rise from the dead (idiom); fig. an unexpected recovery
adversity/predicament
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
perilous situation
to just escape from calamity
nine deaths and still alive (idiom); a narrow escape/new lease of life
